sentences.en: He is so independent that he will never acquiesce.
sentences.cn: 他很有主见,所以绝不会顺从.

sentences.en: He left home because he would not acquiesce to the unhappy marriage.
sentences.cn: 他离家出走是因为他不愿意接受那不幸福的婚姻.

sentences.en: Her parents will never acquiesce in such an unsuitable marriage.
sentences.cn: 她的父母决不会答应这门不相宜的婚事.

sentences.en: I had to acquiesce in her decision despite my private opinion.
sentences.cn: “我不得不默认她的决定,尽管我有我自己的看法.

sentences.en: Shakespeare did not acquiesce in discrepancy.
sentences.cn: 莎士比亚对于分歧并不是采取默认的态度.

sentences.en: She wants to marry a poor primary - school teacher but her parents will never acquiesce.
sentences.cn: 她想嫁一位贫穷小学教师,但她的父母永不会默许.

sentences.en: Simply to acquiesce in skepticism can never suffice to overcome the restlessness of reason.
sentences.cn: 但此非能永久安居之处.

sentences.en: Steve seemed to acquiesce in the decision.
sentences.cn: 史蒂夫好像默认了这个决定。

sentences.en: When prominent scientists are prepared to acquiesce in?
sentences.cn: 当知名科学家准备默许?

words.tran_cn: 默认的；默许的；甘心接受的

trans.tran_en: to do what someone else wants, or allow something to happen, even though you do not really agree with it
to do what someone else wants, or allow something to happen, even though you do not really agree with it
